quotes: To follow this goal, since her early teens, she was involved in working and assisting children in summer camps and afternoon Y programs.
She has been involved in education for more than 30 years.

Her work experience follows her degrees, from teaching in early childhood centers to multi-age multi-level classrooms to special needs to courses at various colleges in Florida where she has resided for the past thirty years.
For the past two years, she has become actively involved with educating other charter school personnel on how to develop curriculum and assessments.

organizations.name: Nova Southeastern University
quotes: After obtaining her doctorate from Nova Southeastern University, she became involved with writing articles, lecturing on many educational issues and trends, planning and presenting at State and Local conferences, and writing college courses and grants.

organizations.name: Southern Association for Colleges
quotes: Her school became one of the first Charter Schools in the State to receive SACS accreditation (Southern Association for Colleges).

organizations.name: Charter School Consortium
quotes: She is also an active member in the Charter School Consortium.

organizations.name: Education Speakers Group
quotes: To request information on Dr. Ruth Jacoby, e-mail rjacoby@educationspeakersgroup.com

roles.title: principal of various private schools
quotes: Her experience as principal of various private schools led her to become a principal of four Charter schools with twelve hundred students for grades Pre-K through 9th grade.

roles.title: principal of four Charter schools
quotes: Her experience as principal of various private schools led her to become a principal of four Charter schools with twelve hundred students for grades Pre-K through 9th grade.

roles.title: principal of one of the first Charter Schools in Broward County
quotes: As a principal of one of the first Charter Schools in Broward County, she has proven her curriculum expertise.
Dr. Ruth Jacoby grew up and was educated in Brooklyn, New York.

Her work experience follows her degrees, from teaching in early childhood centers to multi-age multi-level classrooms to special needs to courses at various colleges in Florida where she has resided for the past thirty years.
As a principal of one of the first Charter Schools in Broward County, she has proven her curriculum expertise.
Dr. Jacoby is on several Governing Boards for charter schools in Miami-Dade County.
